content.title: Pradhan Mantri Formalisation Of Micro Food Processing Enterprises
content.details: Launched on 29th June 2020, PMFMPE is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme by the Ministry of Food Processing Industries, designed to address the challenges faced by the micro-enterprises and to tap the potential of groups and cooperatives in supporting the upgradation and formalization of these enterprises.
benefits: Support to individuals and groups of micro-enterprises.
Setting up a robust project management framework.
eligibility: New Units for One District One Product (ODOP)
documents_required: Aadhaar Copy & Photo of all promoters/guarantors
Address Proof (Utility bill, Property tax receipt, Ration Card)
Photocopy of Bank Statement/ Bank Passbook for the last 6 months

faqs.question: What Is PM FME Scheme?
faqs.answer: PM FME stands for 'Prime Minister Micro Food Processing Enterprises'. PMFME is an all-India Centrally Sponsored Scheme with an outlay of Rs. 10,000 crores for coverage of 2,00,000 enterprises over 5 years from 2020-21 to 2024-25 being implemented by MOFPI.

faqs.question: What Are Micro Enterprises?
faqs.answer: A Micro Enterprise is an enterprise where the investment in Plant and Machinery or Equipment is not more than Rs. 1 crore and the Annual Turnover is not more than Rs. 5 crore.

faqs.question: Is There Any Limit Of Credit Subsidy/Grant?
faqs.answer: Yes, it would be 35% of the project cost with a maximum ceiling of Rs 10 lacs for an individual beneficiary.
